intro: Auriculardisia duriuscula, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with prominent auricle-like appendages at the base of the petals. Auriculardisia duriuscula is popular as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
